info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 17 at 2:48PM EDT until July 17 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Caribou ME
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of North Central and Northern Maine, including the following counties, in North Central Maine, Piscataquis. In Northern Maine, Aroostook. In Maine, Northern Somerset County.
* WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 248 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clayton Lake, Saint Pamphile, Lac Frontiere, Daaquam, Saint Juste, Nine-mile Bridge, Baker Lake, Billy-Jack Depot and Allagash Township. - For flood safety visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Aroostook, ME; Piscataquis, ME; Somerset, ME
